comments.text:
Well Randall is well written, solely for his jokes and basic humorous 
dialogue. Dante is the only voice of reason character I've ever liked, 
because he actually has flaws. He thinks that if he makes no moves in life 
to improve it, he can blame life for dealing him a crappy hand. The reason 
he works at a dead-end job and all that crazy stuff happened to him is his 
own fault, despite how much he shifts the blame. He realizes all of this by 
the end of the movie when he fights Randall.
comments.author: VintageBalderdash

comments.text:
If you really think about it, out of all the actors and actresses used for

Linda Fiorentino and Salma Hayek weren't bad in Dogma if you ask me.
